attributes.action: Make it those with cystic fibrosis automatically transfer from DLA to pip
attributes.background: People suffering from conditions like cystic fibrosis that have qualified for DLA must currently apply for pip at 16 . This is a lifelong degenerative multi system condition requiring daily medications and physiotherapy
attributes.additional_details: Currently in the UK half of cystic fibrosis sufferers live to be over 40 . Daily medication and physiotherapy is required to help reduce mucus build up and antibiotics to prevent infections that will cause scar tissue damage to lungs . Adults with cystic fibrosis must pay for their prescription medication if they work even though not taking it would eventually result in death

attributes.action: Amend Official Secrets Act to prohibit its use in cases involving child abuse
attributes.background: Over several decades the Official Secrets Act has been misused to protect paedophiles in positions of power. This is contrary to the public interest and we call on the government to amend the act to ensure that this can not happen again.

attributes.action: Stop the closure of our St Leonards Community Hospital Dorset.
attributes.background: The St Leonards Community hospital was donated to the Health authority in Dorset when the Americans went back to the USA after WW2.  Local feeling is that we need this Hospital.please help to save one of our community Hospitals thank you.
attributes.additional_details:
We have worked hard for our community hospital and it is usually 98% full this helps with bed blocking here in Dorset.

http://www.stleonardsfriends.co.uk/ for more information.

attributes.action: Introduce a Brain Aneurysm Awareness month to help save lives.
attributes.background: Approximately 1 in 50 people unknowingly have a brain aneurysm as most are only discovered if they rupture. This leads to an extremely dangerous condition known as a subarachnoid haemorrhage which can cause extensive brain damage. Help us raise awareness by signing. Know the facts, save a life!
attributes.additional_details:
NHS Facts
Approx 3 out of 5 people who suffer from a SAH die within 2 weeks. Half of those who survive are usually left with brain damage or disability.

http://www.nhs.uk/Conditions/Aneurysm/Pages/Introduction.aspx

attributes.action: Stop the reduction of rehabilitation, recuperation sevices at Harcombe House.
attributes.background: The UK Fire Fighters Charity registered number 1093387 have three centres currently offering, rehabilitation, recuperation and support functions to UK Fire Fighting personnel and dependants. One of these centres Harcombe House in Devon has been issued with proposed plans for drastic reduction.
attributes.additional_details:
Harcombe House In Devon has undergone a proposal to reduce the services offered due to increased demand and a steady decline in fundraising income
This petition is asking for a small income from the government to help support this very valuable resource. If the UK government gave 0.5 % of its overseas aid to a home grown valuable charity the reduction in services at Harcombe House would not take effect. 

Please support this petition so your local fire fighters have the support they deserve.

attributes.action: Introduce mandatory self-defence classes into UK secondary schools
attributes.background: I propose that the UK Government introduces mandatory self-defence classes, or a self-defence programme, into the Physical Education (P.E.) part of the curriculum in secondary schools to equip children with the skills they need to defend themselves against an attacker.
attributes.additional_details: Children of today are regularly facing the threat of assault in a range of scenarios from bullying within schools to street abductions. I feel it is incredibly important to start equipping children with key self-defence skills in order to defend themselves against an attack effectively – without putting themselves in further danger. UK self-defence law should be taught as part of any self-defence classes or programmes introduced into schools; to prevent self-defence being used inappropriately.

attributes.action: Overturn NHS decision to stop children's heart surgery at Glenfield Hospital
attributes.background: My godson's life was saved by the amazing and caring staff at this hospital, as we're many more. We should be helping these places of excellence not closing these departments!

attributes.action: make a pass card for parent and child parking like disabled to stop misuse
attributes.background: It's not about being close to the shops it's about having the extra room to open the doors fully to get children in and out of the car easier and not damaging other people's cars. It's also a safety factor for children as well. I want cars to display a pass similar to a disabled pass as proof
attributes.additional_details:
Too many people are abusing these spaces that don't have children because they are too lazy to park a car further down the car park. As a parent it is very difficult to get a push chair and child out of a normal sized car space. 
To park in a parent and child space you should display a pass like disabled do if you don't have one you should recieve a fine like people do in a disabled space that don't display a pass

Better control is needed for the safety of children and other peoples property

attributes.action: Art50: Wait for a proposal from the EU on reform, before triggering Article 50.
attributes.background:
Art50 Petition: How to tame the Brexit madness.

People in Britain and Europe are angry with their governments. Frexit or Nexit would tear the financial, economic and political fabric of Europe apart, inflicting further damage on people’s lives.

Stop the Brexit madness! Sign the Art50 Petition!
attributes.additional_details:
UK should request EU proposals on:

- Making EU institutions directly accountable to voters
- Improving cooperation where needed, while protecting national sovereignty 
- Creating a dynamic EU economy, with inclusive growth for all citizens
- Concrete steps to stabilize the Euro, while protecting non-Eurozone

Britain shall request no special treatment as part of the reform. 

A second Brexit referendum can be held after EU reform proposals. Only trigger Article 50 after a second Leave vote.

attributes.action: End the council tax for every body
attributes.background: We want the government to End the council tax for every body and we can have more money in our pockets council tax is unlawful

attributes.action: Remove VAT (20%) on AEDs (Automated External Defibrillators)
attributes.background: Help us remove VAT on lifesaving defibrillators.  Did you know Scouts and Guides, Cubs and Brownies, Beavers and Rainbows all have to pay 20% VAT for this emergency life-saving equipment. It is wrong. These are the keenest young people to train and encourage with basic life support skills.
attributes.additional_details:
More defibrillators would be available if this ridiculous tax was removed. This will encourage more young people in their thousands to grow up as the next generation with life-saving skills and a keenness to help others.  Signing this petition could save a life!

Cheaper AEDs (No VAT)
= more AEDs in communities 
+ more young, prepared people to assist victims when a SCA has occurred 
= MORE LIVES BEING SAVED
…..Let’s make it happen

attributes.action: Hold a public inquiry into the institutional bullying of carers by officialdom.
attributes.background: The institutional bullying of family carers (and those they care for) by various official bodies is now a nationally recognised phenomenon. It is known as 'mother blame' (men are also targeted). A public inquiry into this phenomenon is imperative - to address the issues and halt the practice.
attributes.additional_details:
The institutional bullying of carers (and those they care for) is a regular occurrence within local authorities, the NHS and care companies.

If carers stand up for the person they care for, or make a complaint, they are targeted; facing bullying, harassment and intimidation from those who are supposed to help and support them. Tactics employed against carers include the abuse of the MCA, MHA and safeguarding, deliberately incorrect assessments of capacity/need, general harassment and threats.

attributes.action: Give votes urgently to the 5½ million excluded from the Brexit referendum
attributes.background: The political scene is fragile and unstable because of the Government’s small majority with most MPs opposed to Brexit.  Urgently enfranchise the some 5½ million excluded from the Brexit referendum (46½ million electors) so that future elections and referendums are more properly representative
attributes.additional_details:
The 5½ million are
a) 1.5 million 16- and 17-year olds in the UK (as could vote in the Scottish referendum)
b) 2.0 million British Citizens living abroad disqualified by the 15-year rule or because never on a UK electoral roll (as in the Conservatives’ as-yet unkept “Votes for Life” manifesto promise)
c) 2.2 million unenfranchised foreigners living permanently in the UK (as would be electors if in New Zealand)

Numbers are derived from 2014-15 ONS and UN data. For details visit bit.ly/2cn7hrO

attributes.action: More inspections required and legislation for CCTV installation in ALL abbatoirs
attributes.background: The govt has no intention of banning religious slaughter we are told. Our custom of stunning is not being carried out all the time nor being checked thoroughly enough with animals suffering intolerably. Secret filming has proved this many times. Suffering must end!

attributes.action: Fund Research into Ehlers Danlos Syndrome
attributes.background: EDS is a debilitating and often life threatening conditions, there is very little research and we are a long way off a cure, we need research.

attributes.action: Goverment to make it law all assessments on behalf of the DWP be voice recorded
attributes.background: Due to the amount of assessments being overturned by the tribunal that are carried out on behalf of the DWP,If they are all recorded on a machine that will/can record voice then there can be no mistakes made as to what was said at the  interview and in the long run this will save tax payers money.
attributes.additional_details:
i and many others have had a bad time with company`s that do medical assessments for the DWP many times what has been written in the assessment the claiment says is wrong so if all interviews are voice recorded this would eliminate incorrect  evidance
the claiment should be allowed to supply there own voice recording equipment and record the interview
in my own case i had an interview at home and 4 mths later was booked another one company lied and said no one had been to see me i won my case

attributes.action: Ban the slaughter of all animals and sale of meat and dairy in the UK
attributes.background: The farming and slaughter of animals is barbaric and cruel. The consumption of meat and dairy is unsustainable for the planet. Large areas of land and forest are being destroyed globally. Animals are sentient beings who deserve the same rights as the humans they share the Earth with.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.livescience.com/27692-deforestation.html

attributes.action: Put Anglo Saxon history,  on the national curriculum for secondary schools.
attributes.background: To many people the history of our country starts with William the Conqueror.  But there is a long and colourful history before this. A history that includes the formation of our country, the laying down of laws that are still in use today and the only English king ti be given the moniker "The Great"

attributes.action: Demand Regulation for Extreme Sports #ExtremeSafety
attributes.background:
Extreme sports are not fair ground attractions. Let’s get our MPs working with other EU member states to recognize this life-threatening activity requires serious regulation.

Sign and share this petition today. Tweet #ExtremeSafety to save lives.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-london-33618917

http://change4kleyo.org/

attributes.action: Take the lead in bringing internationally mandated prosecutions against SriLanka
attributes.background: We the undersigned urge the British government to take the lead in bringing internationally mandated prosecutions against former and serving officials of the Sri Lankan state for the crimes of genocide, war crimes and crimes against humanity committed against the Tamils.
attributes.additional_details:
In the last stages of the armed conflict in Sri Lanka, 146, 679 Tamils became unaccounted for - either massacred or ‘disappeared’ by the Sri Lankan armed forces.

The UN announced in September 2015 that if established before a court of law, Sri Lanka’s actions may amount to war crimes and/or crimes against humanity. Subsequently, the UN High Commissioner for Human Rights noted that if independent trials were to take place, a court of law may even find Sri Lanka guilty of committing genocide.

attributes.action: Introduce longer fixed sentences for persistent serious offenders
attributes.background: Introduce longer fixed sentences for persistent serious offenders and tougher conditions and limits on their human rights whilst in prison
attributes.additional_details: My daughter was attacked by a persistent offender and very seriously injured.  She subsequently died as a result of her injuries and the psychological impact of the assault.  This offender will remain a risk to other people if he is ever released.

attributes.action: Debate the cost of gluten free food and why more isn't done to help families
attributes.background:
My daughter has just been diagnosed with celiac disease and I was so surprised at the amount of money it costs just to buy simple food . And the lack of variety available 
 Also how bad the packaging is labelled informing you of the ingredients

attributes.action: Make it a requirement that all Primary School Teachers are First Aid Trained.
attributes.background:
Implement First Aid Training into Teacher Training Courses at universities and schools. 

Make First Aid Training a prerequisite for any person before they become a Qualified Teacher and are left in charge of a class of up to 30 children alone, between the ages of 4 and 11.
attributes.additional_details:
There is no legislation stating a minimum number of First Aid trained staff in a primary school. 

Currently it is up to the Governors and Head Teacher to carry out a risk assessment, based on the outlay of the school, students, staff and other factors, as to how many members of staff they need to be First Aid trained. 

Class Teachers are left alone with up to 30 children in their care, yet there is no legislation stating that they need to have had any previous First Aid Training.

attributes.action: Ensure all children and young adults with autism can access suitable education
attributes.background: Children and teenagers are more likely to be excluded from education as the provision is not meeting their needs. Children are stigmatised for behaviours caused by autism and made to feel that they caused their own exclusion.
attributes.additional_details: Please refer to our Facebook and Twitter campaign pages Action for ASD for more information

attributes.action: Stop the sale of Castle Armoury Bury.
attributes.background: Castle Armoury is a Grade II listed building and is currently occupied by a Platoon of Fusiliers. For over 100 years the building has been in use by Fusiliers in their home town of Bury. We believe that so long as their are Fusiliers in Bury, Castle Armoury should be their home.
attributes.additional_details: Plans have recently been announced that after 100 years of continuous use Castle Armoury is to be sold. The occupying Fusilier Platoon is to be moved to a as yet unannounced location along with the Army and Air Cadets. Since before the start of the First World War the building has been occupied by the Fusiliers and stands as the final link between Fusiliers of the present and those who went away to war never to return. The building is still in use and occupied by serving soldiers.

attributes.action: After the EU vote, we call for the dismantlement of the unelected House of Lords
attributes.background: As the UK has voted to "take back control" from the EU from what was claimed to be a democratically unaccountable Brussels, we propose that the UK should follow this line of reasoning and "take back control" from the un-elected House of Lords by dissolving it.
attributes.additional_details:
The British Parliament contains one of the world's largest decision making bodies called the House of Lords. The peers of this House are un-elected. 

In the EU, the British people could appoint European members of Parliament. But the elected European Parliament is also complemented by un-elected Institutions. The British confirmed they do not want to be apart of this. As the House of Lords is in the British Parliament, the British people have the capability to remove this un-elected House.

attributes.action: Remove all religious representatives from any Parliamentary institution.
attributes.background: Our Government should be 100% secular and should have no religious bias from any religious group. This means removing The Lords Spiritual from the House of Lords and removing any religious ceremony or act from any part of Parliamentary processes.
attributes.additional_details: The lack of secularism in our society promotes inequality through the definition of people and organisations by their affiliation to religious institutions. To combat inequality, our Political Leaders must be independent of all religious influence, irrespective of the religion, so that all decisions can be made in a fair and balanced way. This independence cannot be accomplished whilst we have members of one religious institution in Parliament in any form.

attributes.action: Make Washington Tyne & Wear independent from Sunderland City Council
attributes.background: Since Sunderland City Council took over Washington Development Corporation they have used our money to pay for upgrades and improvements to Mowbray Park, Barnes Park, the City Centre and we in Washington are being left out in the cold. Our public services have been cut severely. Take back control
attributes.additional_details: Facebook group Washington in Decline has seen the addition of almost 1,600 member in the last 2 days. Residents from around Washington are uniting in this common cause to stop the rot. Photographs of the litter, the overflowing bins, the fly tipping,  the overgrowing trees and shrubbery and the grass verges along our roads and highways that are causing disruprion and becoming a danger to motorists. We need to stop this NOW. We need an independent voice and independent Council!!

attributes.action: Make not paying a taxi/private hire soiling fee a criminal offence.
attributes.background:
Why is the soiling fee not a criminal offence when not paying the fare on the meter is a criminal offence.

So many times drivers are put off the road while they get there car cleaned and back up to standard, why should the driver be out of pocket when it was no fault of the driver.

attributes.action: Recognise care work is a skilled job and put a banding system in place
attributes.background: The average care worker is paid the minimum wage give or take 5%, regardless of whether or not they have experience and qualifications. It is said to be unskilled, yet there are various care qualifications sought after by employers. Why? Because care work is a skilled job which requires training!
attributes.additional_details: The current care system fails both care workers and service users. I propose that HCAs have a banding system. Band 1 will be apprentice carers, paid the minimum wage, band 2 will be level 2 carers and be paid 25%+ above minimum wage, band 3 (senior) +50%, and band 4 (deputy/coordinator) +75%. I also propose band 1 cannot lone work until 6 months shadowing has been done. This will encourage training, ensuring the quality of care provided is of the standard it desperately needs to be!

attributes.action: Stop Government using advertising on Gov sites to promote  'Remain in Europe '.
attributes.background: Their action falls under Purdah rules which prohibit Ministers, Departments and local authorities from publishing any promotional material arguing for, or against any particular outcome or any of the issues involved in the Referendum. The Government know the 28 day rule but intend to 'flaunt it' !
attributes.additional_details:
The Government can only issue facts not suppositions or concocted figures to support their views in trying to influence the outcome of the vote. They tried on 9th September 2015 to change the rules specifically for the referendum but were defeated. Certain Gov't members/supporters of the Remain campaign are using any and every method possible to influence the electorate to vote to remain.
This is a serious breach of existing Rules and must result in immediate removal from office.

attributes.action: Abolish Universal Credit and keep Tax Credits and Child Tax Credits.
attributes.background: Due to issues around late payments, vastly reduced payments call center advisers that are ill informed, sanctions that are unrealistic, failing to deal with claims at basic levels. Forcing people into poverty and debt, vastly reduced rates for disabled children/adults. Plus an Incompetent IT system.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.theguardian.com/society/2016/may/03/universal-credit-cost-cutting-treasury-benefit-reform-resolution

http://www.theregister.co.uk/2016/05/03/universal_credit_it_could_start_to_creak_think_tank_report

http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/universal-credit-will-increase-child-poverty-mps-warn-a7023061.html

http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/news/liverpool-news/universal-credit-cuts-hit-liverpool-11313093

attributes.action: Improve policies,procedures and legal requirements associated with Gas Safety
attributes.background: Although engineers must be Gas Safe registered to work on boilers and other gas appliances, the policies, procedures and legal requirements around this are so vague that people without the necessary skill and knowledge are putting peoples homes and lives at danger.
attributes.additional_details:
To ensure that only gas safe engineers are able to complete gas related works, we would like to make the following legal requirements.
- Retailers are able to sell Gas related products, parts and materials to registered engineers who show their card at the time of purchase.
- Gas Safe Engineers are required to present their card before entering a customers home when completing any gas work
- No commercial contracts made that relate to gas work without the inclusion of a gas safety registration number and copy of a gas card

attributes.action: DVLA to create a driving test specific to the geared scooter at 210cc limit
attributes.background: Scooterists are having to learn on large powered motorcycles in order to access an additional 85cc only. Not only is the training irrelevant, but subjects the rider to risks outside those which he chose to engage to road on a scooter. Training should be relevant to the end purpose.
attributes.additional_details:
Scooter enthusiasts are having to ride motorcycles to pass their test. As a result, many take a CBT biannually, which is increasing in cost exponentially. 2014 £50 with hire 2016 £100-120 with hire

Petition sponsored by Scooter Workshop Community

attributes.action: Give legal rights to Aunties and Uncles
attributes.background: Recently my niece was taken into care but there was nothing I could do to stop that from happening because I'm just an auntie. I tried to contact the Solicitors for legal aid, but because I was just an auntie, I was told I have no rights to appeal or apply for custody. I want this changed.

attributes.action: Restrict all dog breeding establishments to a maximum of 5 litters per year
attributes.background: The Panorama programme on BBC1 highlighted the horror of puppy farming. These people own hundreds of dogs and make vast sums of money from breeding puppies, many of whom are sick or have inherited conditions. Restricting all breeding establishments to 5 litters a year will eradicate puppy farms.
attributes.additional_details: There is a wealth of evidence on puppy farming and that local authorities are routinely granting licences to establishments that are churning out puppies that are sick, have inherited conditions and behaviours issues due to the limited human contact and the conditions they are raised in.

attributes.action: Highways England to set 50mph speed limit on A34 between Chieveley & West Ilsley
attributes.background: The A34 between Chieveley and West Ilsley currently has a national speed limit (70mph) and carries significant volumes of traffic past slip-roads with very poor intervisibility between vehicles joining and proceeding along the A34 at East Ilsley and Beedon. This results in frequent accidents.

attributes.action: All Vegan products on sale in the UK should bear a standard identifying logo.
attributes.background: Shopping for Vegan products in the UK is notoriously difficult. Especially for those who are even the slightly visually impaired as ingredient lists are often in tiny print. This should include all food & drink products, health care & beauty products and clothing including shoes.

attributes.action: Reverse the unfair changes to the State Pension Age imposed on 1950's women.
attributes.background: Thousands of women born in the 1950's expected to receive their State Pension when they reached 60 and planned accordingly. The speed at which the SP changes were introduced and for many with little or no notice has deprived them of their rightful pension. Our SP was earned - it is not a benefit.

attributes.action: MPs under investigation should not be allowed to sit in the House of Commons
attributes.background: MPs under investigation for election fraud should not be allowed to sit in the House of Commons. How is it possible for us to live in a democracy when our own MPs are not held accountable for their actions, and even if they are the police answers to the house so it's therefore a conflict of interest

attributes.action: Allow the British people to bear arms again
attributes.background: Because of the constant threat of islamic terrorism the British people should be allowed to bear arms in order to protect their families,
attributes.additional_details: Throughout Europe Islamic terrorists have killed hundreds of innocent people & to try to save lives then the British public should once again be allowed to carry guns to defend their loved ones from harm, We the British people want the same rights afforded to the people of the USA, France & Germany who do have the means to defend themselves when needed!!!

attributes.action: Extend paid maternity leave for mums who have premature babies in hospital.
attributes.background: After having a premature baby at 26+1 gestation and having spent 13 weeks in hospital. That's a third of my maternity leave used without having my baby home. Many other mums have the same problem not being able to take the unpaid leave due to not being able to afford it.
attributes.additional_details: I believe that if you have a baby more than 10 weeks early that has a long hospital stay, you should be able to apply for extended maternity pay and not start your official maternity leave till your baby is home so that you get the same privilege as a mum who has a full term baby with 9months paid at home with your child.

attributes.action: A complete ban of the Hijab in our armed services and our emergency services.
attributes.background: The armed and emergency services are here to serve Britain. Anyone who moves here and wants to join should respect the role and the uniform.  It should not be changed to suit their needs. The face should be displayed at all times as its is a figure of respect.  The Hijab is a health & safety risk

attributes.action: Stop the proposed freight hub at Gailey destroying our greenbelt land!
attributes.background: Government plans to build a railway freight hub on our greenbelt land are devastating our local community. We are fed up of being lied to. This is our wildlife and our peace and quiet - please get involved by signing our petition and stopping there being a 'one rule for one' culture with greenbelt!

attributes.action: Ensure Bill Of Rights affords as much protection for vegans as Human Rights Act.
attributes.background:
By protecting vegans from discrimination and bullying, the Human Rights Act makes it easier to stay vegan - indirectly reducing animal exploitation.

But leaving the EU, and replacing the Human Rights Act with a Bill Of Rights, puts such protection at risk.

More at http://veganrights.uk
attributes.additional_details:
If the UK remains a party to the European Convention on Human Rights, vegans may have to rely on foreign courts (in Strasbourg) for protection.

But if the UK also withdraws from the European Convention on Human Rights, vegans may not be protected at all.

So either way, it is vital that the Government's Bill of Rights, intended to replace the Human Rights Act, provides just as much protection.

We would also expect to see the same protection for all other groups currently protected by the Act.

attributes.action: Stop importing puppies under 6 months of age into the UK.
attributes.background:
Many thousands of puppies are imported at the moment. 
The majority are bred in terrible conditions in puppy farms.
The parents live a life of misery and abuse.
Thousands of dogs are being destroyed every year.
The murder of mans best friend must stop.
attributes.additional_details:
It's estimated 40,000 puppies come from Ireland alone each year.
Some puppy farms there have a thousand bitches !Kept in terrible conditions.
Other EU countries would have even worse conditions. 
The UK can stop this cruelty by banning the importing of puppies.
The general public buy puppies from online sellers. They want young baby pups.
These are often dealers,including pet shops, who buy puppies cheaply from abroad, Many of which are sick or even dying.
They often have physiological issues !

attributes.action: Make driving a car using a mobile phone a disqualification offence
attributes.background: So many people killed and injured by car drivers using there phone and killing people and the offence gets 3 point on your licence. It's as dangerous as drink driving
attributes.additional_details: Every week in a newspaper you can read of a person getting killed or injured by someone using a mobile whilst driving

attributes.action: Allow paganism to be taught in religious education lessons
attributes.background: All religions should be covered in the curriculum not just the chosen few.  The younger members of society should be able to make an informed choice to what religions are around and what they stand for.

attributes.action: All NHS trusts to offer a minimum of 2 funded fertility treatments.
attributes.background:
We have been struggling with infertilty for the last 6 years, we have had various drugs and one Funded IVF cycle.
We got pregnant with IVF. Our baby boy was born pre-term (18wks) and didn't survive. 
This petition is to help others in a similar circumstance to us, to have another NHS funded cycle.
attributes.additional_details: Not all NHS trusts offer the same amount funded cycles.

attributes.action: Form a Select Committee on the causes of the recent rise in xenophobic behaviour
attributes.background: Police report that hate crimes have increased substantially since the EU referendum, which has been taken by some to legitimise racist & xenophobic activity. Politicians of all parties must work together to oppose this, and avoid encouraging such behaviour with careless statements and actions
attributes.additional_details: A  Select Committee should provide an opportunity for politicians to consider whether (inadvertently or not) their statements and actions have contributed to the present deplorable situation. It should also focus on exposing those elements of the media which are peddling misinformation and fostering hatred. Members of Parliament, working across party lines, should develop strategies to oppose racism and xenophobia and demand effective action from the Government.
